title: Alien Zoo Adventure #39
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Observation Deck
rooms.description: A circular viewing platform overlooking alien habitats below. Strange bioluminescent creatures move behind reinforced glass walls. Emergency lights cast an eerie red glow. Control panels flicker with alien symbols. The air smells of ozone and something distinctly otherworldly.

items.name: emergency supply locker
items.description: A metal locker with compartments for emergency equipment

items.name: facility operations manual
items.description: A worn handbook with facility protocols and procedures
items.text: XENOZOOLOGICAL RESEARCH STATION 39 - Operations Manual. Director: Dr. Kira Voss. Security Chief: Commander Rex Thorne. Remember: Specimen 7 arrived in year 742 of the Galactic Calendar. All staff must know emergency protocols.

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A plastic keycard with a magnetic strip and security clearance level 2

items.name: observation terminal
items.description: A computer terminal displaying alien specimen data

items.name: specimen analysis report
items.description: A digital report about the alien creatures in containment
items.text: SPECIMEN LOG: Specimen 7 (Nebula Serpent) - Highly intelligent, telepathic abilities. Specimen 12 (Void Crawler) - Aggressive, contained in habitat 3. Specimen 23 (Star Moth) - Docile, feeds on cosmic radiation. All specimens secured in the habitat wing.

items.name: reinforced viewing glass
items.description: Thick transparent material separating you from the alien habitats below. Strange creatures move in the shadows.

items.name: security door
items.description: A heavy door with a card reader leading to the research lab

rooms.name: Xenobiology Research Lab
rooms.description: A sterile laboratory filled with alien specimens in containment tubes. Holographic displays show rotating 3D models of bizarre life forms. Research stations line the walls, covered in notes and data tablets. A large containment unit dominates one corner. The escape shuttle bay door is visible to the north.

items.name: research station alpha
items.description: A workstation covered in notes about Specimen 7
items.text: Research Notes - Dr. Voss: Specimen 7 shows remarkable intelligence. It seems to understand our language. During tests, it kept pointing to the habitat wing, as if trying to communicate something important.

items.name: research station beta
items.description: A workstation with security protocols and staff information
items.text: Security Memo - Commander Thorne: All personnel must memorize emergency questions for shuttle access. Q1: Who leads this facility? Q2: Where are the specimens kept? Q3: Who maintains security?

items.name: large containment unit
items.description: A cylindrical tank containing a glowing alien organism suspended in fluid

items.name: research data tablet
items.description: A tablet with encrypted research files and personal logs
items.text: Personal Log - Dr. Voss: The specimens are not just animals. They're intelligent beings. We've been keeping them prisoner. I've programmed the shuttle to accept anyone who can prove they understand what we've done. The habitat wing holds the truth.

items.name: specimen containment tubes
items.description: Glass tubes containing various small alien creatures in stasis

items.name: laboratory cabinet
items.description: A locked cabinet with biohazard warnings

items.name: powerful flashlight
items.description: A heavy duty flashlight with an intense beam

items.name: shuttle bay access door
items.description: A reinforced door leading to the escape shuttle. A security terminal displays three verification questions.

password_questions.question: Where are the specimens kept?
password_questions.hint: Look at the specimen report and research notes

password_questions.question: Who maintains security?
password_questions.hint: The facility manual lists the security chief

rooms.name: Emergency Shuttle Bay
rooms.description: You've made it to the shuttle bay! A sleek escape shuttle sits on the launch pad, its engines humming with power. Through the bay windows, you can see the stars and the promise of freedom. The shuttle door is open, inviting you to safety. Warning lights flash as the automated launch sequence begins.

items.name: emergency escape shuttle
items.description: A small but sturdy spacecraft designed for emergency evacuations. The cockpit glows with ready indicators.

items.name: launch control console
items.description: A terminal showing the shuttle is ready for immediate departure

items.name: observation windows
items.description: Large windows showing the vast expanse of space beyond the station

rooms.win_message: You board the escape shuttle and initiate launch! The engines roar to life as the station falls away behind you. Through the viewport, you see the alien zoo facility growing smaller. You've escaped Xenozoological Research Station 39! As you set course for the nearest inhabited system, you can't help but think about Dr. Voss's words - those weren't just specimens, they were prisoners too. But that's a problem for another day. Right now, you're free. You win!
